pr_title: Update RemoveSnapshots to protect cherry-picked data.

timeline.bodyText: Instead of updating a static variable that we need to clean up between test cases, how about using the delete callback? I think that's going to be a better way to test.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Can you move this to a separate PR? I don't think we need to update RemoveSnapshots and deprecate a method at the same time.
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,11 +40,13 @@
 public interface ExpireSnapshots extends PendingUpdate<List<Snapshot>> {
 
   /**
-   * Expires a specific {@link Snapshot} identified by id.
+   * Expires a specific {@link Snapshot} identified by id. This API isn't compatible with
+   * cherry-pick functionality (issue #744), and hence marked Deprecated.
    *
    * @param snapshotId long id of the snapshot to expire
    * @return this for method chaining
    */
+  @Deprecated

replies.bodyText:
Also can we possibly provide a message to use an alternate API for deprecation. Something like -
@Deprecate("Use `expireOlderThan()` method instead")
replies.author: rominparekh

timeline.bodyText: Quick note: this case needs a follow-up because we could expire A and B, then later expire C (not in the current table state) and not be able to detect that we should not delete its files. Expiring B means that we need to also expire C.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
NOTE: I think we can handle this case, i.e. when picking a snapshot for expiration, we should also pick its source snapshot, but considering the gotchas, I would recommend to keep the API simple with expireOlderThan. Also our use case is to use expireOlderThan API for now.
I will log a ticket for this.
replies.author: mehtaashish23

timeline.bodyText: I think these tests should be in the suite for snapshot expiration, not the suite for WAP. Can you move them?
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: The tests shouldn't use WAP properties at all. Correctness depends on where commits were picked and should ignore the WAP ID. The reason is that two commits with the same WAP id don't contain the same files. They are logically the same data, not physically the same files. The only equivalence that matters is when a snapshot itself has been picked because the files are physically the same.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: @mehtaashish23 - Can you add a UT for each scenario we are trying to handle? It might help debug in case we see rogue behavior. Thanks.
replies.author: rominparekh

timeline.message:
Issue-744: Support for ExpireSnapshot functionality on top of cherrypick

PR Feedback

Issue-744: Support for ExpireSnapshot functionality on top of cherrypick

PR Feedback

timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: This shouldn't use the name wap, since this is independent of the WAP pattern.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Continuing indentation should be 4 spaces from the start of the previous line, not 8.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.message:
Issue-744: Support for ExpireSnapshot functionality on top of cherrypick

UTs

timeline.bodyText: Having D (cherry pick of B) isn't possible, if B is already an ancestor, encountered this while writing UTs.
timeline.author: mehtaashish23

replies.bodyText:
The case that would cause this is:

A is committed
B is staged
C is committed
B is picked to create D
The table is rolled back to C
B is picked to create E

The main thing is the rollback, which can cause alternate branches with the same commit picked. I would expect in practice to have other commits (like one between C and D that is removed by the rollback) but we don't need those to test this case.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: The label "this commit" makes sense in context for RemoveSnapshots because it is iterating through snapshots/commits. It makes less sense here. Instead, I would use "current" and note which commits are expiring (e.g., "expiring A and B").
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: I think it would also be easier to understand if this explicitly labeled the source with (source=B) instead of just (B).
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Can you change this to an overwrite and also delete FILE_A? We should also test that deleted files are not physically deleted.
timeline.author: rdblue
rdblue

replies.bodyText:
+1, it would be good to add exact files, after considering following.

Apart from dataFile, we do delete manifests as well for dangling snapshots
The order in which the files are deleted, shouldn't matter, so I have handling that as well.

I think, we should have couple of test to check manifest deletes in case of normal remove snapshots API. Let me know, I can log a ticket explicitly for that, if you agree.
replies.author: mehtaashish23

timeline.bodyText: Nit: should have a newline before this comment.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: You can simplify this and avoid using expireSnapshotId by using expireOlderThan a future time (like you do in the next test). Snapshot B won't expire because it is the current snapshot.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: It wasn't clear at first why this was needed, but it is to avoid using a fast-forward commit instead of a cherry-pick. Can you update the comment in RemoveSnapshots since the case there isn't possible?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I have also changed another UT, which was not taking care of fast forward.
replies.author: mehtaashish23

timeline.bodyText: Why does this remove files from the set instead of using assertEqual?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: The order was coming to be different, and I didn't wanted to rely on order.
replies.author: mehtaashish23

replies.bodyText: Comparing two sets would not rely on order.
replies.author: rdblue
